level_enum.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_LEVEL_ENUM_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_LEVEL_ENUM_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // level_enum.hpp:
00011

00018 
00019 namespace boost {
00020 namespace serialization {
00021 
00022 // for each class used in the program, specify which level
00023 // of serialization should be implemented
00024 
00025 // names for each level
00026 enum level_type
00027 {
00028     // Don't serialize this type. An attempt to do so should
00029     // invoke a compile time assertion.
00030     not_serializable = 0,
00031     // write/read this type directly to the archive. In this case
00032     // serialization code won't be called.  This is the default
00033     // case for fundamental types.  It presumes a member function or
00034     // template in the archive class that can handle this type.
00035     // there is no runtime overhead associated reading/writing
00036     // instances of this level
00037     primitive_type = 1,
00038     // Serialize the objects of this type using the objects "serialize"
00039     // function or template. This permits values to be written/read
00040     // to/from archives but includes no class or version information. 
00041     object_serializable = 2,
00043     // once an object is serialized at one of the above levels, the
00044     // corresponding archives cannot be read if the implementation level
00045     // for the archive object is changed.  
00047     // Add class information to the archive.  Class information includes
00048     // implementation level, class version and class name if available
00049     object_class_info = 3
00050 };
00051 
00052 } // namespace serialization
00053 } // namespace boost
00054 
00055 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_LEVEL_ENUM_HPP
